meanings.definition: Related to biology or living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biologically diverse rainforest is home to many different species.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the biologically important processes that occur in cells.
meanings.sent3: The biologically themed party had guests dressed up as their favorite animals.
meanings.sent4: Her love for animals was so strong, it was almost biologically ingrained in her.
meanings.sent5: The biologically inherited traits of the family were evident in all the siblings.

meanings.definition: In a way that pertains to the study of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: She approached the experiment biologically, focusing on the effects on living organisms.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the specimen biologically under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled as the teacher biologically explained the process of photosynthesis.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked biologically, always curious about the intricacies of life.
meanings.sent5: The research was conducted biologically, ensuring accurate results in the study of living organisms.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is characteristic of living things.
meanings.sent1: The robot moved biologically, mimicking the natural movements of animals.
meanings.sent2: The plant grew biologically, responding to sunlight and water.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter bubbled biologically in the oven, just like a living organism.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was so fluid, it seemed almost biologically inspired by nature.
meanings.sent5: The virus spread biologically through the population, affecting individuals in a living-like manner.
